channel.title: Music
channel.description: NPR Music features, streams, live concerts and music news.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Tall Glass Of Rock Star-Ness: A Q&A With Questlove
item.description: Questlove, drummer and co-founder of The Roots, is coming out with a memoir in June called Mo' Meta Blues, co-written with Ben Greenman. The musician spoke with NPR intern Lidia Jean Kott about why the movie Spring Breakers made him feel like less of a rock star, and whether you can ever outgrow being a dweeb.
item.content:encoded:
Questlove, drummer and co-founder of The Roots, is coming out with a memoir in June called Mo' Meta Blues, co-written with Ben Greenman. The musician spoke with NPR intern Lidia Jean Kott about why the movie Spring Breakers made him feel like less of a rock star, and whether you can ever outgrow being a dweeb.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Heavy Rotation: 10 Songs Public Radio Can't Stop Playing
item.description: Download new music from hip-hop veteran N.O.R.E., indie-rock favorites Telekinesis and Phosphorescent, soul man Charles Bradley, folksinger Samantha Crain and many more in this special edition of Heavy Rotation.
item.content:encoded:
Download new music from hip-hop veteran N.O.R.E., indie-rock favorites Telekinesis and Phosphorescent, soul man Charles Bradley, folksinger Samantha Crain and many more in this special edition of Heavy Rotation.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Remembering Colin Davis, A Conductor Beloved Late In Life
item.description: The English conductor was knighted in 1980 and won three Grammys — but did not reach the real heights of his career until he was in his sixties and seventies. Famed for his interpretations of Berlioz, Sibelius and Mozart as well as contemporary composers, he died at age 85 on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
The English conductor was knighted in 1980 and won three Grammys — but did not reach the real heights of his career until he was in his sixties and seventies. Famed for his interpretations of Berlioz, Sibelius and Mozart as well as contemporary composers, he died at age 85 on Sunday.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: First Listen: Steve Martin And Edie Brickell, 'Love Has Come For You'
item.description: With assists from fellow stars such as Esperanza Spalding and Sara and Sean Watkins of Nickel Creek, Martin's banjo lines sing and sway with grace and charm that seem effortless. Edie Brickell's plainspoken warmth pairs wonderfully with Martin's playful picking throughout.
item.content:encoded:
With assists from fellow stars such as Esperanza Spalding and Sara and Sean Watkins of Nickel Creek, Martin's banjo lines sing and sway with grace and charm that seem effortless. Edie Brickell's plainspoken warmth pairs wonderfully with Martin's playful picking throughout.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: First Listen: Brass Bed, 'The Secret Will Keep You'
item.description: A sad parade of loneliness, death, fear and madness comes to life on an oddly buoyant album. Brass Bed's dark themes are wrapped in sunny melodies and mysterious synth sounds that ultimately dissolve into glorious chaos. It's part sonic exploration, part infectious pop and part noise rock.
item.content:encoded:
A sad parade of loneliness, death, fear and madness comes to life on an oddly buoyant album. Brass Bed's dark themes are wrapped in sunny melodies and mysterious synth sounds that ultimately dissolve into glorious chaos. It's part sonic exploration, part infectious pop and part noise rock.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: First Listen: Laura Mvula, 'Sing To The Moon'
item.description: Mvula's mix of classic soul and modern breeziness can be difficult to locate on a calendar, let alone a map. Classically trained and only 26, she writes songs that sound like the whole world at once.
item.content:encoded:
Mvula's mix of classic soul and modern breeziness can be difficult to locate on a calendar, let alone a map. Classically trained and only 26, she writes songs that sound like the whole world at once.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: First Listen: Mother Falcon, 'You Knew'
item.description: Formed as a free-wheeling, 15- to 20-piece side project for a group of orchestra students, Mother Falcon crafts a sound that soars with the grandiosity of Arcade Fire at its most anthemic. Its second album, You Knew, captures the hugeness of a band that can't fit on many of the stages it plays.
item.content:encoded:
Formed as a free-wheeling, 15- to 20-piece side project for a group of orchestra students, Mother Falcon crafts a sound that soars with the grandiosity of Arcade Fire at its most anthemic. Its second album, You Knew, captures the hugeness of a band that can't fit on many of the stages it plays.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Nick Drake's Producer Remembers 'A Real Musician's Musician'
item.description: The English folk artist died long before his songs found a wide audience. Joe Boyd, who produced two of Drake's three albums, is releasing an album of live performances culled from a series of Nick Drake tribute concerts.
item.content:encoded:
The English folk artist died long before his songs found a wide audience. Joe Boyd, who produced two of Drake's three albums, is releasing an album of live performances culled from a series of Nick Drake tribute concerts.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: On The Road With Dawes, The Band Behind The Band
item.description: The country rock band Dawes has built a grassroots following opening for other bands. As they release their third album, Stories Don't End, they're preparing to tour with their biggest headliner yet: Bob Dylan. Weekend Edition Sunday host Rachel Martin speaks two members of Dawes, singer and guitarist Taylor Goldsmith and keyboardist Tay Strathairn, about life on the road.
item.content:encoded:
The country rock band Dawes has built a grassroots following opening for other bands. As they release their third album, Stories Don't End, they're preparing to tour with their biggest headliner yet: Bob Dylan. Weekend Edition Sunday host Rachel Martin speaks two members of Dawes, singer and guitarist Taylor Goldsmith and keyboardist Tay Strathairn, about life on the road.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Will Lightning Strike Twice For K-Pop's PSY?
item.description: After weeks of threats from North Korea, some South Koreans turned their attention this weekend away from weapons and toward a new song by the country's global rap star, PSY. On Saturday night the singer unveiled his follow-up single and video to the viral phenomenon, "Gangnam Style," at a sold-out concert.
item.content:encoded:
After weeks of threats from North Korea, some South Koreans turned their attention this weekend away from weapons and toward a new song by the country's global rap star, PSY. On Saturday night the singer unveiled his follow-up single and video to the viral phenomenon, "Gangnam Style," at a sold-out concert.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Yeah Yeah Yeahs On Love Songs, New York And Transforming On Stage
item.description: Ten years after the trio's debut album, singer Karen O says she and her bandmates are still shy in conversation. But when they perform together, "it's explosive."
item.content:encoded:
Ten years after the trio's debut album, singer Karen O says she and her bandmates are still shy in conversation. But when they perform together, "it's explosive."

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Jazz In The Cafeteria: Kids Learn To Listen While They Chomp
item.description: At Alice Terry Elementary School in Colorado, a music teacher decided the students should occasionally have a "silent" lunch break. No talking, just listening to live music. Ami Hall says hearing new sounds makes children curious, which then carries over into other subjects.
item.content:encoded:
At Alice Terry Elementary School in Colorado, a music teacher decided the students should occasionally have a "silent" lunch break. No talking, just listening to live music. Ami Hall says hearing new sounds makes children curious, which then carries over into other subjects.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Thao Nguyen's Musical Life Is Far From 'Common'
item.description: A trip to a California women's prison inspired many of the songs on the folk-rocker's latest album, We the Common.
item.content:encoded:
A trip to a California women's prison inspired many of the songs on the folk-rocker's latest album, We the Common.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Dave Matthews Takes John Denver's Music 'To Tomorrow'
item.description: Matthews joins a diverse cast — including Emmylou Harris, My Morning Jacket and Old Crow Medicine Show — to honor the late singer-songwriter on a new tribute album.
item.content:encoded:
Matthews joins a diverse cast — including Emmylou Harris, My Morning Jacket and Old Crow Medicine Show — to honor the late singer-songwriter on a new tribute album.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Extreme Drama: The Life And Music Of Richard Wagner
item.description: Marking the 200th anniversary of the controversial composer's birth, conductor Marin Alsop and friends rethink Wagner in a series of multimedia concerts.
item.content:encoded:
Marking the 200th anniversary of the controversial composer's birth, conductor Marin Alsop and friends rethink Wagner in a series of multimedia concerts.
